title: [Security] Symlink escape vulnerability in PathValidator
description: PathValidator does string-only canonicalization and does not resolve symlinks, so an allowed-prefix path can escape via symlink. If this is used for security boundaries, need filesystem canonical check (std::filesystem::canonical/weakly_canonical) or post-open path verification. File: src/path_validator.cpp. Found in Codex review of PR #12.

title: [Security] Double-encoded path traversal bypass in PathValidator
description: ValidatePath only URL-decodes once, so double-encoded traversal like %252e%252e%2f can bypass ContainsTraversal. Fix: Implement iterative decode with max depth or reject if decoded output still contains %2e/%2f patterns. File: src/path_validator.cpp. Found in Codex review of PR #12.

title: VFS Abstraction: Enable cloud storage for config and SQL files
description:
Implement DuckDB VFS integration to support reading configuration, endpoint definitions, and SQL files from cloud storage (S3, GCS, Azure, HTTP). Closes GitHub issue #10.

## Goals
- Abstract file operations through DuckDB's FileSystem interface
- Support URI-style paths (s3://, gs://, az://, https://)
- Maintain backward compatibility with local filesystem paths
- Enable hot-reload scenarios with configurable caching

## Phases
1. VFS-aware configuration loading (ConfigLoader adapter)
2. HTTP streaming bridge for file serving
3. Serverless packaging and documentation

## Key Files
- src/config_loader.cpp - Add VFS routing
- src/include/config_loader.hpp - VFS adapter interface
- src/sql_template_processor.cpp - Use VFS for templates
- New: src/vfs_adapter.cpp/hpp - DuckDB VFS wrapper

## References
- GitHub Issue: https://github.com/DataZooDE/flapi/issues/10
- Design Doc: docs/features/flapi-10-fs-abstraction.md

```cpp
class CachingFileProvider : public IFileProvider {
    IFileProvider& underlying_;
    std::unordered_map<std::string, CacheEntry> cache_;
    std::chrono::seconds ttl_;
    size_t max_cache_size_;
};
```

```yaml
    ttl: 300  # seconds

```

- LRU eviction when max_size exceeded

title: Implement path validation and security layer
description:
TDD Step 7: Security-first path validation to prevent traversal attacks.

## Test First
Write tests in test_vfs_security.cpp:
- Test rejection of '..' in paths
- Test rejection of paths outside allowed prefix
- Test canonicalization of relative paths
- Test scope checking against allowed_paths config
- Test URL scheme whitelisting

## Implementation
Create PathValidator class:
```cpp
class PathValidator {
public:
    std::optional<std::string> ValidatePath(
        const std::string& user_path,
        const std::string& allowed_prefix);
    bool IsSchemeAllowed(const std::string& path);
    std::string Canonicalize(const std::string& base, const std::string& relative);
};
```

## Security Rules
1. Reject any path containing '..' after URL decoding
2. Resolved path must start with allowed_prefix
3. Only allow configured schemes (default: file, https)
4. S3/Azure require explicit configuration to enable

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Path traversal attacks blocked
- [ ] Clear error messages (no path leakage)
- [ ] Scheme whitelisting enforced
- [ ] Tests cover OWASP path traversal patterns
